trans-unit.source: Provides a base class for column providers.
Column providers must extend this class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> class and the ADO.NET Entity Framework class are providers that extend this class.
Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance.
This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.
The table that contains the column.
Adds default attributes.

If the `attributes` parameter does not contain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.RequiredAttribute> collection, but the model provider requires this attribute, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.RequiredAttribute> object is added.

If the `attributes` parameter does not contain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.StringLengthAttribute> collection and the column that is represented by this provider is a string, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.StringLengthAttribute> object is added.
The column provider.
The attribute collection.
The attribute collection.
Gets the provider for the table that a column represents.
The provider for a table that a column represents, if one exists; otherwise, `null`.
Gets the attributes that are defined for the column that is represented by this provider.
The attribute collection.
Gets or sets the type of the column.
The type of the column.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Reflection.PropertyInfo"></xref> value of the property that represents the column in the entity type.
The <xref href="System.Reflection.PropertyInfo"></xref> value of the property that represents the column in the entity type.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is an additional property that is not in the model's data context.
Columns that are not in the data context typically come from a view or calculated property.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.IsCustomProperty%2A> property can be used to determine whether column operations such as sorting are supported.

For example, the implementation of the <xref:System.Linq.IQueryable?displayProperty=fullName> interface of the data model will not support sorting on properties that return `true` for the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.IsCustomProperty%2A> property, because the column does not exist in the database.
`true` if the column is an additional property that is not in the model's data context; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is part of a foreign key.
This property is not set for strongly typed entity reference columns that are members of the table entity (a table object in the data model).
`true` if the column is part of a foreign key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column value is automatically generated by the database.
`true` if the column value is automatically generated by the database; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is part of the primary key for the table.
`true` if the column is part of the primary key for the table; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the column is read-only.
`true` if column is `read-only`; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets a value that indicates whether the data model supports sorting the table by this column.
`true` if the data model supports sorting the table by this column; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the maximum length that is allowed for this column.
This property applies to string data types only.
The maximum length that is allowed for this column.
Gets or sets the name of the column.
The name of the column.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column accepts null values.
This property specifies whether the column accepts null values as defined by the data provider.
For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/handling-null-values.md).
`true` if the column accepts null values; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the table that the column belongs to.
The table that the column belongs to.
Returns the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.Name"></xref> property.

The <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.Name"></xref> property, or the string representation of the object if the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.Name"></xref> property is `null`.
